<item>
<title><![CDATA[Cracks in the code: Why mapping your DNA may be less reliable than you think]]></title>
<link>https://www.theglobeandmail.com/technology/science/genetic-testing/article37829424/?cmpid=rss1</link>
<description><![CDATA[The Personal Genome Project was supposed to revolutionize medicine, but the results reveal how much we still have to learn. Carolyn Abraham looks at the risk of misleading results as DNA testing enters mainstream medicine]]></description>

<title><![CDATA[How a self-proclaimed born quitter found the willpower to finish his first marathon]]></title>

<description><![CDATA[Globe reporter Dave McGinn is a born quitter. At the first sign of adversity, he usually folds like a chair. But in a race that's just as much mental as it is physical, he was able to find a way to persevere, drawing on advice from experts and friends. Here's how he did it]]></description>

<description><![CDATA[Can a diet that has bacon at its centre, and shuns whole grains, actually be the key to a healthy waistline? Journalist Gary Taubes and a spate of doctors claim it is. So why won’t the medical community accept their findings?]]></description>

<item>
<title><![CDATA[Licensed to bill: How doctors profit from injury assessments that benefit insurers]]></title>
<link>https://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/investigations/doctors-insurance-independent-medical-examinations/article37141790/?cmpid=rss1</link>
<description><![CDATA[Doctors are taking in millions of dollars a year by putting their names to accident injury reports for the insurance industry. Some of these reports unfairly discredit injury claims, leaving victims intimidated and exhausted. But because the majority settle out of court, the practice is hidden from public scrutiny. ]]></description>
<pubDate>Fri, 01 Dec 2017 21:20:31 -0500</pubDate>
<guid isPermaLink="false">37141790</guid>
